Package main

Class Calculators

java.lang.Object
main.Calculators
final class Calculators
extends java.lang.Object
The utility class Calculators contains methods for calculating the score of a cribbage hand with a starter card
Author:
Reid Moffat

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • totalPoints

      public static int totalPoints​(java.lang.String[] hand)
      Adds all of the point combinations together for a valid cribbage hand and returns the total number of points

      A valid cribbage hand is defined as a 1-dimensional array of five unique strings, each representing a card in the player's hand and the last string being the starter card. Each card is the value of the card (ace = 1, 2-10 = their respective value, jack = 11, queen = 12, king = 13 [all face cards are worth 10, but we need to distinguish between them for multiples and straights]) plus the first letter of the suit (not case sensitive)

      For example, ["3H", "10S", "5S", "13C", "2D"] represents a hand with a 3 of hearts, 10 of spades, 5 of spades, King of clubs and a starter 2 of diamonds

      Parameters:
      hand - a valid cribbage hand
      Returns:
      the total number of points in this hand
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the hand doesn't have five cards

    • fifteens

      public static int fifteens​(java.lang.String[] hand)
      Returns the number of points obtained from fifteens in the given cribbage hand

      Each combination of cards that add up to 15 is worth two points. Any number of cards can be used, and cards may be used for multiple fifteens. All face cards are worth 10 points for fifteens

      For example, ["4H", "5S", "6S", "13C", "1D"] has two fifteens: 4 + 5 + 6 and 5 + king

      Parameters:
      hand - a valid cribbage hand
      Returns:
      the number of points obtained from fifteens

    • multiples

      public static int multiples​(java.lang.String[] hand)
      Returns the number of points obtained from multiples in the given cribbage hand

      Multiples are a double (2 points), triple (3 points) or quadruple (12 points) of one value of card. Face cards are not considered the same for multiples; a ten and a queen both have a value of 10 but they would not give points for a double

      For example, ["13H", "10S", "11S", "13C", "12D"] has two points from multiples (double kings)

      Parameters:
      hand - a valid cribbage hand
      Returns:
      the number of points obtained from multiples

    • runs

      public static int runs​(java.lang.String[] hand)
      Returns the number of points obtained from runs in a given cribbage hand

      A run is a sequence of three (3 points), four (4 points) or five (5 points) consecutive cards. Suit does not matter, and cards can be part of multiple runs

      For example, ["3H", "4S", "5S", "4C", "4D"] has twelve points from runs. This is because the run 3-4-5 can be made four times by swapping out the two fours and two fives

      Parameters:
      hand - a valid cribbage hand
      Returns:
      the number of points obtained from runs

    • flushes

      public static int flushes​(java.lang.String[] hand)
      Returns the number of points obtained from flushes in a given cribbage hand

      To obtain a flush, the player's hand must have all four cards of the same suit (4 points). If the starter card is also the same suit, 5 points are obtained. Note that if only three cards in the player's hand plus the starter card have the same suit, this is not a flush

      For example, ["3H", "10H", "5H", "13H", "2H"] has 5 points from flushes

      Parameters:
      hand - a valid cribbage hand
      Returns:
      the number of points obtained from flushes

    • nobs

      public static int nobs​(java.lang.String[] hand)
      Returns the number of points obtained from nobs in a given cribbage hand

      One point is obtained from nobs if the player's hand has a jack of the same suit as the starter card

      For example, ["3H", "11S", "5S", "13C", "2S"] has one point from nobs because the jack in the player's hand has the same suit (spades) ad the starter card

      Parameters:
      hand - a valid cribbage hand
      Returns:
      the number of points obtained from nobs
